entry.title: Re: Unable to Connect SAP Business Application Studio and...
entry.content:
Turns out I had the incorrect audience url. Stupid but easy mistake when copying and pasting URLs. The SAP traces gave a descriptive error then that pointed to an incorrect audience property.

For S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition:

  • The API endpoint uses the format: https://[tenant]-api.s4hana.cloud.sap
  • The SAML audience (entity ID) uses the format: https://[tenant].s4hana.cloud.sap

__PRESENT

__PRESENT

entry.title: Unable to create SAP Document AI Trial instance (plan blocks_of_100)
entry.content:
Dear SAP Support Team,

We are currently testing the SAP Document AI Trial service and have encountered an issue when trying to create a new instance — either via Booster or manually through the BTP Cockpit.

Each attempt fails with the following message:
Couldn't create an instance of service 'SAP Document AI Trial' with plan 'blocks_of_100'.
Operation failed.

The same behavior occurs across multiple trial subaccounts and for different users. Additionally, previously created instances cannot be deleted and show the status “Deletion Failed”.

We understand this is a trial environment, but could you please advise whether this behavior is expected or if there is any known limitation or temporary issue affecting the SAP Document AI Trial service?

Any guidance or confirmation would be highly appreciated.

Thank you in advance for your help and time.

entry.title: How to show Return Reason on CBAR Item Level in Incompletion Log
entry.content:
Using Manage Customer Returns - Version 2, when creating a Return Order, if the Item Level Return Reason is left blank the incompletion Log does not show the specific field. 

How can we get this to display?


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Re: How to show Return Reason on CBAR Item Level in Incom...
entry.content:
Use configuration step (SSCUI) 'Define Incompleteness Procedures' 101189 to create a new incompleteness procedure and assign it as necessary using SSCUIs: 101193, 101198, 101207, 101192, 101190, 101191.

Create your incomplete procedure.

Add the relevant fields, e.g. Sales Order Item Level . Table Name VBAP , Field Name ABGRU

Assign the Returns Procedure to the correct document e.g. CBAR. 

Carry out the relevant testing on the test environments before proceeding onto a Production system.

entry.title: Train-The-Trainer: SAP Build Apps (Americas focus)
entry.content:
Instructor: Prof. Simha Magal

Description:  SAP Build Apps is a no-code development offering from SAP.  According to SAP, Build Apps is a “no-code app builder tool to help business professionals develop enterprise-grade applications for desktop, browser, and mobile.”  SAP Build Apps is part of the SAP Build platform which also includes SAP Build Process Automation and SAP Build Work Zone.  In this workshop, participants will learn how to create applications using SAP Build Apps.  One app will include an internal backend database and the second will interface with an SAP S/4HANA system to retrieve and present information in the app.

Course Duration:  Two days.  Nov 24 and 25, 2025

- Start time 11:00 AM US Eastern time (to accommodate US West coast participants).   

- End time: 6:00 PM 

Agenda

Day 1 agenda:  Create an app to interact with an internal database

  • Introduction to SAP Build and Build Apps
  • System information and login.
  • Create an internal database
  • Create an app to perform CRUD operations on the internal database

Day 2 agenda:  Create an app to retrieve and display sales order data from an SAP S/4HANA system 

  • Review SAP S/4HANA system and data
  • Discuss available APIs in the S/4HANA system
  • Discuss integration between Build Apps and SAP S/4HANA systems via OData APIs 
  • Create an app to retrieve a list of sales orders for a selected customer, with a drill down to order details.
  • Discuss options for using SAP Build in the classroom

Registration link will be shared soon! 

Interested? 
We look forward to seeing you there!

SAP University Alliances

entry.title: Re: Guidance: creating 4 separate pricing procedures for...
entry.content:
Hi @trachanhtranchauden ,

By default the same pricing procedures are used for OR (standard sale), RE (return), CR (credit memo request), DR (debit memo request), and invoice correction request (RK). RE, CR, DR, RK are used to handle issues with the standard sale like complaints and other issues that require correction. In most of these cases the document is created with reference to the original OR or invoice. The pricing is copied and if needed corrected. In some cases some additional conditions types are used for extra fees. Most of my clients use the same pricing procedure for all of this.

Most companies have also additional order types for special business, e.g. charging of special services. Once I created for this a pricing procedure that contained for each account assignment just a single manual price condition. As I write this I am wondering why the hell did we do this like this. Other options exist. And this brings us to the most important point. You need to understand the requirements of the client / user first. Only afterwards can you come up with a good solution. There is no secret best practice. 

A good starting point are the SAP best practices and the configuration of these best practices.

entry.title: Live Versions from an SQL Source for SAP Analytics Cloud Planning
entry.content:
Introduction

Live data access for planning is a big theme of the QRC4 2025 release in SAP Analytics Cloud. We already shared how live versions now unlock a new chapter for seamless planning in SAP Business Data Cloud (link). But the paradigm of live data access is coming for models that are not deployed to SAP Datasphere as well! In this case, live versions can link data from our available live SQL sources. So, this applies to our existing connection to Google BigQuery and shall apply to live SQL sources that we add going forward (Microsoft Azure, Snowflake,…). Learn how to add a live version from Google BigQuery in this blogpost!

How does it work?

Adding a live version to a model is easy. It is also easy to create a model from view in Google BigQuery. Here, I will show you how to add a live version to an existing model.

  • In your model details, you will find a new entry in the ‘Data’ section which is called ‘External Live Version Data Sources’
  • Here, ‘Connect External Data Source’
  • Choose an existing target version for the data source or create a blank version
  • Choose Google BigQuery as source system (more to be added in the future)
  • Choose connection
  • Choose your datasource from Google BigQuery
  • Map the data source columns to your model’s columns
    • Not all source columns need to be mapped
    • Not all target columns need to be mapped
      • Measures can be NULL
      • Dimensions can receive a default member
    • Certain data type differences can be handled
  • If we detect a mismatch between the live version and your master data, we will notify you and you can add missing dimension members directly (not shown in the video)
  • We also provide performance hints
  • Use the data in calculations, data actions, stories etc.! In the video, you see the live data in action in a model calculation
  • You’re done! You can add more sources to the model, if you want

Adding and using a live version from Google BigQuery

FAQ

Where can I use this feature?

This feature is available for SAP Analytics Cloud models that are not deployed to SAP Datasphere (=not using seamless planning).

Can I use any source view?

Yes. However, not all data types are supported (details).

What can I do with live versions? (And what can I not do?)

You can display the live version data in the model data foundation and in tables, charts, etc. in stories.

You can reference the live version data in model and story calculations as well as data actions (incl. advanced formulas).

You cannot write back to the source. You can copy the live version data into planning versions via copy/paste in the table, data actions and version management.

How do I see if data is live or not?

In models, a live version is highlighted in the data preview. In the version dimension, you see the data source per version.  

In tables, live version data is locked for data entry and formatted accordingly. Reasons for unplannable data give accurate information.

Conclusion

Live data access in planning models represents a massive opportunity. SAP Analytics Cloud demonstrates openness and flexibility by offering live versions from live SQL sources.

entry.title: Report Center not honoring RBP — HR admins seeing all employee data (salaries etc.)
entry.content:
Hi Community,

We are running into a serious issue with Report Center / reporting in SuccessFactors: it seems that RBP (Role-Based Permissions) is no longer being respected in reports.

  • Until recently, reports limited users to only their permitted target population.

  • Now HR admins can run reports and pull all employees’ data (including salaries), even outside their scope.

  • This behavior happens in Production only; in Preview, permissions still work correctly.

  • We compared a “Permissions to User” (RBP) report in both systems — role/population assignments look identical.

  • Interestingly: via the regular UI, the user cannot see those out-of-scope records — the leak happens only via reporting.

Has anyone else seen this “RBP bypass via reports” issue? A few questions:

  • Are there known bugs where reports ignore target populations or field-level permissions (e.g. for salary/compensation)?

  • Could caching, metadata sync, or permission propagation delays cause the differing behavior between Prod and Preview?

  • What logs or diagnostics should I check (report audit logs, data model logs, debug traces, etc.)?

  • Could an API, integration, or backend load (e.g. OData, People Analytics) be retrieving data outside RBP?

  • Are there any interim mitigations or guard rails (e.g. masking, other controls) we can apply immediately?

Thanks in advance for any insights or similar experiences you can share!

Appreciate your support!

entry.title: SAC - Time Dimention ID and Description: sorting and labeling
entry.content:
Hi expects,

We have configured a bar chart where we show accumulated data along different time options: Hours, Days, weeks, months and years. They want to switch along them (being selected only one by one) in order to see the different accumulated data.


Focusing in Hours (type: String) :

  • customer wants to see the members like: HH DD-MM-YYYY 
  • Originally members comes from Datasphere like: YYYY-MM-DD HH

The problem here comes with the sorting: Sorting must go ascending (obviously):

  • For YYYY-MM-DD HH format works fine: 2025-09-01 10, 2025-09-01 11, 2025-09-01 12 and so on
  • For HH DD-MM-YYYY , the sorting works like: 10 01-09-2023, 10 01-09-2024, 10 01-09-2025 and so on

The only chance I think we have is to set up the dimension in this way:

  • ID must be with YYYY-MM-DD HH format and then the sorting will work following the ID
  • Description Must be with format HH DD-MM-YYYY and theoretically

Is there any way to do this? Any suggestion? Thank you in advance!

entry.title: Re: Created Custom Business Object in SAP Public Cloud In...
entry.content:
Hi @shivakumar_p 

Thanks for the clarification.

Have a look at Custom Business Objects, Custom CDS Views & Maintain Form Templates for more details.

Please note that when you create Custom Business Objects through In-App extensibility, it is not automatically exposed as a CDS-based form data sources in the Maintain Form Template app.

To enable the use of CBO in a form, you need to:

  • Enable Service Generation in your CBO.

  • Create a Custom CDS View using your CBO as the data source.
  • Mark the CDS for Form Template Usage and publish it.
  • Create your form in Maintain Form Templates and use the aforementioned CDS view.

Let me know if you have further questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: SAP CTMS: Destination Configuration with SAP IAS and OAuth2Password
entry.content:
Hi MathiasL, 

In SAP BTP, I believe there isn’t a separate option called “technical user” that you create directly in the cockpit. The term technical user is more of a functional concept than a specific user type. A technical user simply means a non-personal user account (not tied to an individual employee) that’s created in your Identity Provider (IdP) for example, in SAP Identity Authentication Service (IAS) or Microsoft Entra ID (Azure AD) and used purely for automation or system-to-system communication (like CI/CD, Terraform, or Transport Management).

So practically:

  • You create this user in your IdP (IAS, Azure AD, etc.) with a username and password.

  • It’s assigned the necessary roles in the BTP subaccount (e.g., Org User, Space Developer, etc.).

  • It’s authenticated via OAuth2Password (not via SSO or an interactive login).

entry.title: Re: Various Solutions to Handle Maternity Leave in EC Time Management
entry.content:
Hi community

We just ran into an interesting case - dealing with Maternity Leave - Parental Leave (Germany)

1. We enter a Maternity Leave - with open end (calculated birth date).

2. Once the baby is born, this is entered in the corresponding field and then a new leave (Parental) leave is entered with start date = birthdate of the baby.

3. Then the person who gave birth returns after parental leave and continues working...

What we experienced:

1. The system generates a Return from Leave - for Maternity Leave.

2. The system generates a Return from Leave - for the Parental leave

How do you handle this?

As in our understanding there should not be a Return from Maternity Leave followed by Parental Leave?

(This would mean to actions at the same date - and this creates troubles in replication towards SAP HCM ...)

Best Regards from Tyrol

Daniel.

entry.title: Re: Unlocking the Next Chapter of Seamless Planning in SAP Business Data Cloud with Live Versions
entry.content:
Hi @Hartmut_Koerner884 

In the demo, you see dimensions without dimension tables. They are columns in your model that can be grouped (e.g., ID+description+properties), level-based hierarchies can be built on top etc. 

From these columns, you can easily create dimension tables. In that case, we will fill the members based on the data in the source view at the time of creation. Afterwards, the dimension table needs to be managed and maintained as we do not have dimension reuse yet. 

I recommend the following blogpost to learn more about the concept of dimensions with/without dimension tables: https://community.sap.com/t5/technology-blog-posts-by-sap/adding-new-functionality-and-flexibility-to-the-sap-analytics-cloud-new/ba-p/13575510

entry.title: Re: SAC - Time Dimention ID and Description: sorting and...
entry.content:
@Private_Member_253331 

Either setup your dimension ID in correct sort order or you could create a calculated dimension and get the order right. But its advisable to set the dimension right if you have still not designed it yet. As of now SAC does not allow to setup sort order using an attribute of the dimension where you could setup the correct order.

Hope this helps !

Nikhil

entry.title: Re: Not enough memory printing report from C++ Client 32-...
entry.content:
Hi Anders,

Often Terminal Server per user has a limit to the amount of memory it can access. Check the TS Forums on how to expand that memory per user/application.

Does it work fine if not using TS?

And we've discussed this before, Dll's do not have the ability to drill down to the root cause, it can only go 1 level to pass the error to the host program, so it may not actually be caused by CR runtime, CR is simply passing the error to you, since your app is the host application.

Have a great day

Don

entry.title: Re: Issue with "Make to Order" Calculation Variant PC04
entry.content:
According to SAP documentation Make-to-Order (MTO) Sales Order Costing , PPC4 is delivered by default with requirement classes like S46, S45, S40, S60, and 046, and uses valuation variant 001. If PPC4 is missing in SSCUI 106410, it may not be scoped or activated in your system configuration.

What you can do is go to CBC (Configuration Environment) and verify that the Sales Order Costing scope item is active. If PPC4 is not available, raise a ticket with SAP to request activation or correction of missing configuration.

entry.title: SAP Crystal Report for Visual Studio Log4Net issue
entry.content:
We use SAP Crystal reports in many of our applications. I have installed SAP Crystal report runtime  SAP Crystal report for visual studio.net version 13.0.38.5404. Screenshot shared below

 

I am getting the following runtime exception on executing my .net application.

InnerException = {"Could not load file or assembly 'log4net, Version=1.2.10.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=692fbea5521e1304' or one of its dependencies. The located assembly's manifest definition does not match the assembly reference. (Exception from HRESULT: 0x80131040...

When running .Net application it is looking for Log4Net with this version 1.2.10.0 and publickey token 692fbea5521e1304 . When I decompiled the CrystalDecisions.CrystalReports.Engine.dll assembly , I can see that it references log4Net with public token 692fbea5521e1304.

I believe some of new SAP crystal report binaries still reference the old log4Net with  public key token 692fbea5521e1304  however newer CR runtime seem install log4net with  public token 669e0ddf0bb1aa2a. 

Note : My application is not referencing any other version of log4net and neither does the bin directory of the application have the assembly.

In CR runtime SP38, some assemblies still reference log4net PublicKeyToken=692fbea5521e1304. Is there a patch/hotfix to re-sign those or update references ?  Request a re-signed log4net that uses the old token but contains updates, or a version of the affected Crystal assemblies rebuilt against the new token.

entry.title: Re: Custom Report/Query with Business Partner ID and Cust...
entry.content:
Dear @Katharinam

1. Create custom fields for Manage Business Partner Master Data app it’s possible in Custom Fields app with business context below:

 

Please remember to switch enabled in I_BUSINESSPARTNER like below.

It will give a access when you create CDS view in step 2 for YOUR custom fields.

2. To create custom report you can use Custom CDS View app with data source: I_BUSINESSPARTNERSUPPLIER or I_BUSINESSPARTNERCUSTOMER.

In elements tab add for example your custom fields starts from YY1_*

 

Result: Custom CDS View with ID and custom field

 

More details below:

https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_S4HANA_CLOUD/0f69f8fb28ac4bf48d2b57b9637e81fa/e30de6eae4d24d70b65996ac8ff88848.html?utm

Best Regards,

Dawid

entry.title: Automatic Attachment Transfer from Quality Notification to Service Entry Sheet in S/4HPublic Cloud
entry.content:
Hi Team,

We have a requirement to transfer attachments from a Quality Notification (QN) to the Service Entry Sheet (SES) during its creation.

Below are the steps currently being followed:

  1. Purchase Order Creation

  2. Quality Notification Creation

    • Enter the Purchase Order number, Vendor Invoice number, and the related invoice amount in the QN.

    • Attach the Vendor Invoice to the QN.

  3. Service Entry Sheet Creation

    • Create the SES with reference to the Purchase Order.

    • Enter the Quality Notification number.

    • The user expects the attachment from the QN to be transferred automatically when saving the SES.

Please let us know if this functionality is supported or if any configuration or enhancement is required.

entry.title: What are the most effective approaches for planning and executing a large-scale application moderniz
entry.content:
"I'm part of an IT leadership team at a mid-sized organization, and we’re starting to explore application modernization to improve scalability, agility, and overall business efficiency. Many of our critical systems are legacy applications that have been in place for over a decade, and we’re facing challenges with performance, integration, and maintaining outdated code. We’ve heard a lot about strategies like containerization, microservices, DevOps practices, and cloud-native architecture, but it’s overwhelming to decide where to start.

My question to the forum is: What are the most effective approaches for planning and executing a large-scale application modernization initiative? How should we prioritize which applications to modernize first, and what are the key pitfalls to avoid during the process? Additionally, how can we ensure a smooth transition to cloud environments and modern architectures while keeping ongoing operations stable and secure?"

entry.title: Re: Embed Crystal Reports in a distributable file
entry.content:
I highly suggest you post your issues on the WIX forum, they may have run into these errors and have suggestions on how to work around them.

Also, CR's Merge Modules only include CR runtime, it does not include any dependencies, you need to manage them yourself.

By default CR installs to this folder, which could be one of the errors generated:

C:\Program Files (x86)\SAP BusinessObjects\...

So it's possible your installer is suggesting it should not use that x86 folder, not sure how to avoid that error or warning.

As for this comment "There are no errors if I comment out the MergeRef line, so it is responsible for all of them."

I again suggest contacting WIX to see what the issues are if you don't use that line...

There are 32 bit 3rd party dependencies still being used for backward compatibility, CR Internally "thunks" these dependencies to 64 bit. Should ignore them.

As for the Azalea font error CR runtime does not include the font's and UFL they use, it gets installed in CR Designer only, so you'll need to contact Azalea for the distribution file. They are not include in CR for VS distribution files.

entry.title: Invoice Print Type - IDOC vs Form (Fragmented Forms)
entry.content:
Hello Gurus,

I'm looking for some inspiration and war stories from you talented people.
Are we the only ones struggeling with the Print Type settings in the pricing procedure when controlling output in the our Adobe Forms as well as INVOIC IDOC?

Background: In our pricing procedure we're using Print Type to control both line item pricing display on the form as well as determine value in IDOC Segment E1EDP26 (INVOIC02). Business wants these two outpu to differ in certain countries - E.g. Form to show a set of pricing, while IDOC typically containing more.

We have tried: Changing the content of the form directly, supressing values from the Print Type setting, leaving a mismatch between Print Type and actual print. However, using the same form across multiple countries, following method significantly increases complexity.

Have any of you successfully managed to separate the Print Type setting for the form content from IDOC content? Any advice on how to implement the split?

Appreciate you time,
Best regards,
Aske

SAP S/4HANA SD (Sales and Distribution)

entry.title: Re: Modify a report's data source at runtime in C# from Visual Studio
entry.content:
FYI - Ido has been supporting Crystal Reports for 20+ years now and has a thorough understanding how CR works....

Also, do you still need to use DBF files? I highly recommend to convert your data sources to MS SQL Server or some other "real SQL DB data source". I realize it's not that easy to do but in the long term it may make things much easier to migrate for current and future reports.

To answer your questions....

What I always recommend to new developers using CR runtime is to do what you want in CR Designer first, then the same work flow is required when coding.

For example, open the Report in CRD, Set Location to the new Data Source and NOTE is the Field Mapping UI pops up, if so you'll need to set links in code. And also note if Verify Database message appears, you may or may not have to use the Verify() function, sometimes you don't want to use it... It can clear the updates you have applied....

NOTE: If the  mapping UI does pop up it indicates the JDBC driver uses a different file type than the DBF field type uses, CR JDBC dll can't map the field type to the source field type....

If you still want to code this yourself Book mark this page:

https://help.sap.com/docs/SUPPORT_CONTENT/crystalreports/3354091173.html?locale=en-US

On that page I wrote a sample app that will get you started:

how-to-parameters-in-crystal-reports-for-visual-studio-net

What you need to do is Clone() the new connection info, use a report you manually updated the connection info to the JDBC connection property. Then open the report and use ReplaceConnection() API to set the Old/New property bag info.

Fix any field mapping's, using the same Clone() API.

And as Ido suggested is save the new report to a new folder, don't update the connection info every time, it's time consuming.

I like to suggest setting a flag in the Reports Summary Info, from the File menu in CRD, you can read the various values to determine if the report has been update of not, set one of the with a comment it's been updated:

So it is possible to do what you want it is a question of programming this yourself or use Ido's solution, which he's done all the head scratching for you....

entry.title: Automating Attachment Transfer from Quality Notification (QN) to Service Entry Sheet (SES)
entry.content:
Hi Team,

We have a requirement to transfer attachments from a Quality Notification (QN) to the Service Entry Sheet (SES) during its creation.

Below are the steps currently being followed:

  1. Purchase Order Creation
  2. Quality Notification Creation
    • Enter the Purchase Order number, Vendor Invoice number, and the related invoice amount in the QN.
    • Attach the Vendor Invoice to the QN.
  3. Service Entry Sheet Creation
    • Create the SES with reference to the Purchase Order.
    • Enter the Quality Notification number.
    • The user expects the attachment from the QN to be transferred automatically when saving the SES.

Please let us know if this functionality is supported or if any configuration or enhancement is required.

 Regards,

Sai.

entry.title: Not able to access Consumption app - what authorizations are needed and how to get them?
entry.content:
Hi team,

I am an admin user for our organization and to check reporting I want to view the consumption in the Finance and Legal section which is currently disabled.

Could you please help to grant me the access for all xxx and xxx environments?

Regards,

 


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Re: Not able to access Consumption app - what authorizati...
entry.content:
Dear customer,

According to KBA 3440820, S-user needs the following authorizations to access the Consumption card in SAP for Me:

  • Access License Utilization for OnPrem 
  • Access License Utilization for Cloud 
  • Access License Utilization for Private Cloud 

Could you pls kindly request the necessary authorizations using the Self-Service Authorization Request feature as mentioned in KBA 2891528?

You may also contact your Super Users directly to get those authorizations. To check who is your super user, kindly access the My Important Contact page.

Hope this helps.

Best regards,
SAP Support

entry.title: Re: SAC - Time Dimention ID and Description: sorting and...
entry.content: when you set the semantic usage to Text (for the description) and relation between the id and the text field, then this allow the user in SAC to select how to see the data for this "column" in the dashboard: the ID, Text or Both.

entry.title: Request for Option to Create Single PM Notification for Multiple Equipment
entry.content:
We are currently unable to create a single PM Notification for multiple equipment at a time in SAP. During the notification creation process, there is no option available to enter or select multiple equipment.
Our requirement is to create one notification that covers multiple equipment, instead of generating separate notifications for each.

Is there a standard process or configuration in SAP that allows this functionality?
If not available in standard SAP, is there any customized solution or enhancement that can be implemented to meet this requirement?

Looking forward to your guidance on this.

 


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Re: Request for Option to Create Single PM Notification f...
entry.content: Only one equipment can be added at notification header level. There is not any option to add multiple equipment.

entry.title: Unable to Delete the Document Type
entry.content:
We have created a custom RFQ Document Type in our SAP S/4HANA Cloud (Public Edition) system under the Customizing tenant (Development Client).Now, we want to delete this custom RFQ Document Type, as it was created incorrectly and should not be used by any users. However, we are unable to delete it through CBC  

 

We would like SAP’s assistance to either delete or deactivate the specific custom RFQ Document Type from our system to keep the configuration clean


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Re: Unable to Delete the Document Type
entry.content:
Hi,

Please note it is not possible to change delivered configuration content and also it is not possible to delete custom configuration entered for RFQ doc types.

The following options are available to prevent particular RFQ document types from being used:

  • Able to mark the unwanted custom entries as 'Do Not Use'.

  • The usage of certain document types can be restricted through authorization profiles.

  • Use the app extensibility feature https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_S4HANA_CLOUD/0e602d466b99490187fcbb30d1dc897c/5db606b1c5a0459ab07ffed4661e42b8.html

Best regards,

SAP Support

entry.title: How to make ByDesign consider available stock from another site before creating a Purchase Proposal
entry.content:
Hello SAP Community,

I’m encountering a planning issue in SAP Business ByDesign related to multi-site stock consideration

Scenario Overview

We have one product maintained in two Planning Areas under the same Planning:

Site Planning Area Procurement Type Available Stock Demand Behavior

Site A (Headquarter)HQExternal Procurement0 ea7 eaSystem created Purchase Proposal for full 7 ea
Site B (Secondary Site)RYInternal Procurement1 ea—Stock available but not considered

Current System Behavior

Type Source Quantity (ea) Comment

Purchase ProposalExternal Supplier7Created in Site A
Stock Transfer ProposalAGRY0000 → AGHQ0000—Not created
Total Supply 7All from external source

Expected Result

Type Source Quantity (ea) Comment

Stock Transfer ProposalAGRY0000 → AGHQ00001Should use available stock first
Purchase ProposalExternal Supplier6For remaining demand
Total Supply 7Covers total requirement in Site A

The system should first consider available stock from another site,
create a Stock Transfer Proposal, and then generate a Purchase Proposal for the remaining quantity.

What setup or configuration is required so that ByDesign can:

  1. Consider available stock from another site,

  2. Automatically create a Stock Transfer Proposal, and

  3. Create a Purchase Proposal only for the remaining demand?

entry.title: Re: Create a Multi Column List Item and Filter & Sort it via Dropdown Fields in SAP Build Apps
entry.content:
Hi @myenilmez 

Thanks for this blog, very easy to read and implement. I'm this close to have my filter work but I'm facing this error message: 

{"code":"requestFailed","status":400,"message":"Request failed with status code 400","rawError":{"error":{"code":"case.20002","message":"Demande erronée :INVALID_ARGUMENT: selectOption.toObject is not a function"}}}

After a couple of tests, I noticed the issue comes from the filter condition I apply to the Get Record Collection logic:

 

I thought it would be due to field not being configured as "filterable" in my table (see note 3515964) but the field is filterable. Other lead would be that the data contained in the field to filter in my table is an array while the one included in the selectedFilter page variable is not (see here)...

What do you think? Have you already faced that?

Thanks for your help,

BR,

LM.

entry.title: Re: Embed Crystal Reports in a distributable file
entry.content:
Thanks for the response. However I eventually solved the issue by instead bundling my project with a CR installer project. I first tried to embed CR with my distributable but it made it unacceptably large. Instead I saved the CR installer to my website so it was at a defined address then added this in my bundle:

			<MsiPackage Id="CrystalReportsRuntime"
						Compressed="no"
						SourceFile="CR13SP34MSI64_0-80007712.MSI"
						DownloadUrl="https://xccomms.com/CR13SP34MSI64_0-80007712.MSI" >
				<!--<MsiProperty Name="UPGRADE" Value="1" />-->
			</MsiPackage>

entry.title: PromptTemplate(Declarative) SyncFailed resource in SAP AI Core
entry.content:
Hello folks,

I am trying to add a Prompt Template(Declarative) from GitHub. GitHub connection is okay, but facing a template sync issue.
Could you please help me out here? Did I miss anything in the template or setup?.

Below are the SyncFailed details:

Sync Status: OutOfSync

Health Message: one or more synchronisation tasks are not valid. Retrying attempt #1 at 11:03 AM.

Sync Details: 

my-scenario-simple-0.0.1
PromptTemplate
SyncFailed
resource promptregistry.ai.sap.com:PromptTemplate is not permitted in project mt-996809a3

 

Template Name: simple.prompttemplate.ai.sap.yaml

name: simple
version: 0.0.1
scenario: my-scenario
spec:
  template:
    - role: "system"
      content: "{{ ?instruction }}"
    - role: "user"
      content: "Some more {{ ?user_input }}"
  defaults:
    instruction: "default instruction"
  additional_fields:
    isDev: true
    validations:
      required: true
    blockedModels:
      - name: "gpt-4"
        versions: "gpt-4-vision"
      - name: "gpt-4o"
        versions: "*"

Thank you.

Kind Regards,
Bhargava

entry.title: Re: How to run "local" tRFC via bgRFC? (local: with no destination or 'NONE')
entry.content: If you just need a Queuing and that the calls are in the right order you could use the QRFC implementation. Its simpler I think. Just set the queue name with TRFC_SET_QUEUE_NAME  and call the function call with Destination NONE or try getting the WF Destination via cl_swf_run_workflow_properties=>get_rfc_destination_name( ).

entry.title: Smartform print and print preview problem
entry.content:
Hi experts,

Now I have seen a few posts wherein smartform print preview display is not the same as the print display. However, I didnt get a solution which I could use for my case.

The output of the print preview is coming as expected.

However, while printing, the output is not giving the expected result. As it can be seen from the screenshot, the underline  for 'Hard License' text is coming with gaps. Also the entire font seems to be different.

As per the previous threads, I already had a word with the BASIS consultant, and he said that there isnt anything he can do to help me. The print preview output is displayed from SP01 and it is marked as 'Completed'. 

I also checked the printer configuration in SPAD but I am not sure how to proceed with this issue. Since the print preview is working fine, I dont think that there is any coding issue here. What can I do to resolve this ? Please let me know if any other information is needed from my end.

Regards,

Manish

Huy

entry.title: Re: C_ACT_2403 – SAP Certified Associate Project Manager – SAP Activate
entry.content: I’d recommend checking out Pass4Exams — they offer updated, real exam-based questions and answers that align with the current SAP Activate syllabus. Their practice materials helped me get familiar with the actual question format, key process areas, and scenario-based topics that come up in the real test.

entry.title: Re: In SAC - Calculate Absent date
entry.content:
@Sowmiya_Chinnappan 

You should explain What defines an absent date, is it those dates of  where you do not have start date ( punching date). Is it a planning model ? If Yes You could use a DA to just check for each date of a month and if there is no punching information, flag the measure as 1 and these dates would be absent days. You might have to be careful about weekends or Holidays though.

Nikhil

entry.title: Re: how to finish installation without license
entry.content:
The problem is if you get a CR Keycode from CR's page by downloading a Trial version, you will get an e-mail with your temp keycode you can use to install, the problem is it expires in a month or so...

And no you can't install without one.

This sounds like a good example of becoming an OEM partner, go here:

https://www.sap.com/products/data-cloud/crystal-reports.html

On the right side there is a Chat button, ask the Sales person about becoming an OEM partner, be aware there are sales requirements to become one...

What they can do is possibly generate a key code you can use for you specific install requirements.... Or have other suggestions.

entry.title: Re: Live Versions from an SQL Source for SAP Analytics Cloud Planning
entry.content:
@Max_Gander This is a great progress in the direction of lean models and avoiding data redundancy. I have 2 questions

  • Although this is not dependent on Datasphere deployment of models, does it still require HANA Cloud migration of the tenant.?
  • Any performance guidelines on this live view consumptions. If the Actuals data size is significant, will it have adverse performance effects on stories and data action usage.

Regards

Nikhil

entry.title: Re: Embed Crystal Reports in a distributable file
entry.content: Great for found a solution... FYI, with CR distributions you MUST use the MSI or Merge Modules. the Installer is too complex to manaully distribute, others have tried and it has never worked....

entry.title: Re: Issue with IDoc File Line Endings (LF vs. CRLF) After S/4HANA Migration
entry.content: LF vs. CRLF is generally dependent on the OS of the system which suggests that maybe you have switched from Windows to Unix/Linux.

entry.title: Re: SAP Datasphere: OData Connector for PowerBi
entry.content:
hello @GUS  @gustavokath ,

we managed to get it working with the technical User, this now supported in the current version.

 

but have you tested this with the Gateaway to support scheduling?

when i want to update the credentials of the connection, i can select OAuth2 but 

 

we're redirected to an URL that ends with:

best regards

Younes

entry.content:
Dear SAP Community,

Please also check the KBA created regarding the Storage Location Subtype too.

3592881 - Customize Subtype in Storage Location

 

Best regards,

Geovana

entry.title: Product Compliance in SAP Cloud ERP Private | 2025 Release
entry.content:
Welcome to our deep dive into the latest advancements for Product Compliance in SAP Cloud ERP Private 2025 release. I am thrilled to walk you through the key highlights for this release, collected with close collaboration with our product management teams focused on asset management.

This collection is part of SAP features released on October 8, 2025

 

These are the topics that are covered:

Product Compliance Foundation

  • Continuous content delivery for product marketability and safety data sheet compliance requirements

Dangerous Goods Management

  • Visualization of information for ADR and RID 1.1.3.6
  • Output scenarios for additional dangerous goods transport documents
  • Integration of mixed loading checks for dangerous goods in sales, delivery, and transportation management
  • Printing dangerous-goods freight documents in transportation management

Safety Data Sheet and Label Management

  • Supporting multi-component products for two or more products in the safety data sheet process
  • Support for branded products in the safety data sheet process

 

Product Compliance Foundation

Continuous content delivery for product marketability and safety data sheet compliance requirements

Business Background

Staying current with ever-changing global regulations is a significant challenge for businesses that market and ship products worldwide. A delay in adopting new compliance rules for product marketability or safety data sheets can lead to shipment stops, fines, and market access issues. Companies need a way to receive and implement these updates without being tied to a major software release cycle, ensuring business continuity and unwavering compliance.


Key Feature


With this innovation, we enable continuous content delivery for product marketability (PMA) and safety data sheet (SDS) compliance requirements via the SAP Regulatory Content Service. This decouples regulatory updates from the main software release schedule. Now you can receive the latest rule sets as they are released, allowing you to remain up to date with the newest regulations. This ensures your product portfolio stays compliant without needing to wait for or implement a new SAP S/4HANA Cloud release.

Image #1: Compliance Requirements Versions

 

Dangerous Goods Management

Visualization of information for ADR and RID 1.1.3.6

Business Background

When transporting dangerous goods, specific exemptions can apply under certain conditions, such as the limited quantity provisions in ADR and RID 1.1.3.6 for road and rail transport. For logistics planners and transport operators, having clear and immediate visibility into whether a shipment qualifies for such exemptions is crucial for ensuring both safety and regulatory compliance, while also optimizing transport costs and processes.

 

Key Feature

To provide this visibility, the "View Markings and Labels; Dangerous Goods" app has been renamed to "Dangerous Goods Information; For the Value Chain" and enhanced significantly. This app now visualizes information related to the ADR and RID 1.1.3.6 agreements, making it easy to see exemption applicability. This feature establishes the foundation for integrating this data into freight units, freight orders, and bookings, helping your teams comply with complex dangerous goods regulations more effectively.

 

Image #2: Dangerous Goods Information – For the Value Chain


Output scenarios for additional dangerous goods transport documents

Business Background

Operating a global supply chain requires adherence to a diverse and extensive array of transport regulations, each with unique documentation requirements. Manually generating specific dangerous goods notes for different countries and transport modes is inefficient and increases the risk of errors, which can cause transport delays and compliance failures.

 

Key Feature

This release introduces a host of new output scenarios to support a wide range of dangerous goods transport documents. This includes support for UNRTDG, ADG, ANTT, NOM, NCh382, NZS, SANS, JT/T 617.3, and ADN notes. You can now use these scenarios to view descriptions in the Classify Packaged Dangerous Good app and leverage public APIs to create compliant transport documents in external systems. This allows you to optimize the utilization of the rich dangerous goods information managed within SAP S/4HANA.

Image #3: Output scenarios for additional dangerous goods transport documents

 

Integration of mixed loading checks for dangerous goods in sales, delivery, and transportation management

Business Background

A critical aspect of transport safety is preventing the co-loading of incompatible dangerous goods. These mixed loading prohibitions are strictly enforced, and violations can lead to severe accidents and legal penalties. To mitigate this risk, businesses require systematic checks to be performed early and consistently throughout the logistics process, from sales to final transport execution.

 

Key Feature

This enhancement integrates dangerous goods mixed loading checks directly into the core logistics value chain. The system now automatically performs these checks on sales orders and outbound deliveries, as well as within Transportation Management for freight units, freight orders, and bookings. This proactive validation helps you prevent the execution of noncompliant and unsafe transports, safeguarding your people, assets, and brand reputation.

 

Image #4: Analyse Delivery Logs

 

Image #5: Display Logs



Printing dangerous-goods freight documents in transportation management

Business Background

To legally transport dangerous goods, shipments must be accompanied by freight documents containing specific, accurate dangerous goods information. Generating these documents separately from standard freight paperwork is inefficient and creates opportunities for inconsistency and error, jeopardizing compliance.

 

Key Feature

You can now print relevant dangerous goods information together with your standard freight documents directly from Transportation Management. This release provides compliant document templates for key regulations, including the ADR dangerous goods note for European road transport, the RID note for European rail, U.S. and Canadian bills of lading, and the IMDG declaration for ocean transport. This integration ensures you can provide freight documents that are fully compliant with the regulations of various countries.

Image#6: Process Request from Logistics

 

 

Safety Data Sheet and Label Management

Supporting multi-component products for two or more products in the safety data sheet process

Business Background

Many industries sell products as kits or sets that contain multiple distinct chemical components, each of which may legally require its own Safety Data Sheet (SDS). Managing and distributing the correct SDS for every component to the customer can be a complex and manual task, risking incomplete communication of safety information.

 

Key Feature

To address this, we now provide the ability to send safety data sheets for multiple components of a product at the same time. When a product is comprised of two or more items requiring an SDS, the system can now group and transmit all relevant documents in a single, consolidated process. This improves your compliance with SDS regulations and ensures your customers receive complete and accurate safety information efficiently.

Image #7: Safety Data Sheets

 

Image#8: Components



Support for branded products in the safety data sheet process

Business Background

Companies often market an identical substance or mixture under various brand names or trade names to serve different markets or customer segments. Sending the same SDS to a customer multiple times, once for each branded product they purchase, is redundant and can create unnecessary administrative work and confusion for the recipient.

Key Feature

This feature introduces support for branded products in the safety data sheet shipment process. You can now configure the system to manage SDS distribution at the branded-product level. This includes deriving the product name on the SDS from the branded product information. This intelligent handling helps you avoid sending redundant SDS documents to customers, streamlining your compliance processes and improving the customer experience.

Image#9: Branded Product Names

 

More information / additional links

Thanks for reading this blog post. Stay ahead by following the latest updates with the PSCC_Enablement tag in SAP Community.

You can find an overview of selected innovation highlights across all lines of business in the blog posts below:

SAP Cloud ERP Private 2025 Product Release Highlights by Bert Schulze

SAP Cloud ERP Private 2025 FPS0 Release Highlights by Harish Mangtani


For more information on SAP Cloud ERP Private, check out the following links:

  • Collection blog for Product Compliance here
  • SAP Cloud ERP Private page
  • SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition | SAP Community
  • Inside SAP S/4HANA Cloud
  • Best practices for SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition
  • Help Portal Product Page 
  • What's New | SAP Help Portal
